background_dashed.customLabel: In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is no difference between TEACCH and controls on Social-communication. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 6 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of TEACCH on Adaptive behaviors. Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 4 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  there is a small-to-moderate effect in favor of TEACCH on Global cognition (IQ). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 6 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is no difference between TEACCH and controls on Language (Expressive skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In School-age (6-12 years old),  there is no difference between TEACCH and controls on Language (Overall skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 6 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.

In Pre-school (<6 years old),  there is no difference between TEACCH and controls on Language (Receptive skills). Based on the analysis of the quality of the evidence produced by the 3 studies exploring this effect, we have a very low confidence in the estimation of this effect.
